_.special: a simple melee weapon of your choice

entries: Either for fun or profit, your life circles around athletics. Perhaps you are a martial arts instructor or an aspiring professional baseball player. Or maybe you simply spend all your time working out, be it Tae Kwon Do, running, or rugby. Whatever the case may be, you participate in the organizations that govern and promote your chosen activities for much of your life.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor=|category=|miscellaneous=}, a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon=|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill acrobatics}, {@skill athletics}, {@skill intimidation}, {@skill medicine}, {@skill sleight of hand}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item First Aid Kit|Superheroic5E}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A medic’s pack, a {@item gym pass|Superheroic5E}, a {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=} of your choice, and $400.

entries.name: Feature: Gym Membership
entries: Because of you long time commitment to your sport, or perhaps because you used to work as a trainer, you have a lifetime membership to a huge chain of gyms and workout centers. In every middle-sized town you visit, you always have a place to shower, change, and work out. You can also visit the local gym and get a feel for the latest rumors and gossip in the neighborhood.

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}

entries: You make your living telling stories that people want to hear—stories that end with you relieving them of some of their money. It's a skill you've developed over time and built through practiced lies, faked documents, and the occasional picked pocket. You sometimes even must become someone else entirely to escape. Your chosen profession is not popular with the police, who do not take kindly to your practices.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor=|category=|miscellaneous=}, a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon=|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill deception}, {@skill insight}, {@skill performance}, {@skill persuasion}, {@skill sleight of hand}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Disguise kit}, {@item Forgery kit}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A {@item criminal's pack|Superheroic5E}, a {@item forgery kit}, a {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=} of your choice, and $400

entries.name: Feature: Permanent Alibi
entries: You have an arrangement with another con artist to serve as each other's alibi, should either of you get into trouble with your schemes. Work with your GM to flesh out this other person. Who are they? How did you two meet and make this arrangement? What might happen if they come asking for this service from you? If you are arrested or charged with a crime, your friend comes forward with an alibi for you, providing a strong piece of evidence that points toward your innocence.

The rich and powerful believe it is their work alone that built their wealth, but you know better. Having worked among the cubicles at one of the world's largest corporations, you know how things work and how to get things done. Your name might not have wealth and prestige attached like those of the CEOs, but you know how to cut through bureaucracy when necessary—and other office plebs are more likely to help you out. Work with your GM to determine which corporation you work for or once worked for and whether you still have pull in the office.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor=|category=|miscellaneous=}, a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon=|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill deception}, {@skill history}, {@skill insight}, {@skill investigation}, {@skill persuasion}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter One tool proficiency|items|source=|type=tools=|category=}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: An {@item officer worker’s pack|Superheroic5E} and $600.

entries.name: Feature: Bureacracy
entries: You have connections in the corporate world. When a bureaucratic issue arises, you can speak to your old fellow officemates and get reliable information about what's going on. Once they learn of your position, most other office workers will also respect you as they might a friend or coworker—except the wealthy bosses, of course, who largely disdain you.

_.item: {@filter one gaming set of your choice|items|source=|type=gaming set|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}

entries: You make your living doing shady work. Perhaps you steal or serve as muscle for other crooks. Some of the most common criminal jobs recently have been credit card skimming and identity theft—lucrative, but dangerous. Whatever you preferred crime, you have spent enough time among the seedier folks in the city to pick up several useful skills. Work with your GM to determine what you preferred job is. Options include burglar, high tech thief, pickpocket, or thug.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter All weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon;martial weapon|category=}, {@filter light and medium armor|items|source=|type=medium armor;light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill deception}, {@skill intimidation}, {@skill sleight of hand}, {@skill stealth}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Thieves’ Tools}, {@filter one gaming set of your choice|items|source=|type=gaming set|category=}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item criminal’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@item thieves’ tools}, a lock, a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=|type=simple weapon=|category=} of your choice, and $400.

entries.name: Feature: You Know a Guy
entries: Whenever you find yourself in a less than savory area or establishment with a good number of people, there is a very good chance you know someone present. If you don't, then you most likely do have a common acquaintance. The connection allows you access to otherwise unfriendly and dangerous areas of the underworld. These connections also often have information that may prove useful. The city underworld isn't that big, after all! But watch out for the police, or they'll throw you in jail!

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: You dance, sing, act, joke, or otherwise entertain people as a living. Perhaps you were brought up in an entertaining family. Possibly it is a path you fell into or chose at some point. Regardless, you now have at least one act that reliably drums up some coin.
Work with your GM to imagine at least one performance you have in your repertoire. Whatever you choose, make sure you can describe a bit of what it looks like when you perform.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill acrobatics}, {@skill deception}, {@skill insight}, {@skill performance}, {@skill sleight of hand}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Disguise kit}, {@filter One musical instrument of your choice|items|source=|type=instrument|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: {@filter One musical instrument of your choice|items|source=|type=instrument|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, a {@item student’s pack|Superheroic5E}, a set of {@item costume clothes}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $200.

entries.name: Feature: Life of the Party
entries: You are practiced at entertaining crowds in public places. If you spend time performing in a public space like a plaza, you can expect to make $20 hour in tips. If you offer to perform at a venue, the proprietor might take you up on your offer and will provide free food, in addition to your tips. Finally, people who watch you perform well will be positively predisposed toward you in any further interactions, though they might also recognize you more easily even when you are trying to lay low

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: Whether you come from another world or simply wish to find the secret places of your own, you spend your time going where others have not. Some explorers plumb the depths of the ocean or sail the most remote seas; still other travel the stars, or even the stream of time, looking for discovery.
Work with your GM to determine what you like to explore and why you do so; are you looking for something in particular, or is it simply novel experiences you seek?

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill insight}, {@skill investigation}, {@skill perception}, {@skill science|Superheroic5e}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item cartographer's tools}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: {@item cartographer's tools}, a {@item servivalist's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $300.

entries.name: Feature: That Reminds Me...
entries: You have seen things others wouldn't believe and have trod in places no one else has. Indeed, your stories make for gripping tales. Scientists, scholars, and storytellers in particular relish listening and learning from you, granting you access to people and places that otherwise might not be open to you.

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: The city may be a bustling metropolis filled with workers and wealth, but it also has a massive number of poor and itinerant people. You were one such person, having lived for at least a few years on the streets and in the alleys of the lower-origin areas among the homeless. You may have panhandled here and there, or perhaps you sung or did a simple dance on a street corner until the police would run you off. Maybe you scavenged in others' dumpsters for food and odd trinkets to pawn. Some of your associates would resort to petty theft

If you like, you may also choose an area of the city you frequented when you were down on your luck. Work with your GM to decide how you ended up indigent and whether you've pulled yourself out of it or not. If so, how? Did someone help you?

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill medicine}, {@skill performance}, {@skill science|Superheroic5e}, {@skill sleight of hand}, {@skill stealth}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item gaming set}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: {@item bedroll}, {@item blanket}, {@item common clothes}, a {@item flashlight|Superheroic5E}, {@item sack} {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $100.

entries.name: Feature: Beggars Can Be Choosers
entries: As a beggar or otherwise impoverished individual, you often had to scrounge for the barest essentials just to stay alive. That's a skill you haven't lost, and it can come in handy. If you spend 8 hours scrounging in an urban environment, you can find one item on the list of Adventuring Gear worth $10 or under. As you move through an area where you once panhandled or scrounged, you can also take shortcuts through back alleys and courtyards, cutting down your travel time significantly. This can be critically useful when trying to escape the police as well, because you can always find a place to hide in such areas.

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: You work issue to issue, selling your photos or stories as you can, submitting it to news agencies or tabloids. Perhaps you had some formal training in journalism school, but it is just as likely that you are mostly self-taught. Maybe you have some articles or photos in a local rag or college student paper. Nevertheless, you have a real and useful skill which you can use to support yourself, as well as a loose network of fellow members of your craft Work with your GM to determine your specific relationship to various news or photography outlets and perhaps even describe a few of your works.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter medium armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill insight}, {@skill investigation}, {@skill perception}, {@skill persuasion}, {@skill sleight of hand}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Photographer’s Kit|Superheroic5E}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item tool set|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item journalist’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@item tool set|phb}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $300.

entries.name: Feature: Track Down a Lead
entries: Your work as journalist or freelance problem solver requires you to be resourceful in finding information you need. You know your way around archives, libraries, and records offices in town, but, perhaps more importantly, also you know who to ask as well. If you spend 8 hours of downtime trying to track down the answer to a question, you'll find at least one plausible answer if it is a question that isn't top secret or entirely beyond the grasp of the people you ask. Whether or not the answer you get is the whole story is sometimes hard to determine, though!

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: You make your living by the sweat of your brow and through your exertions, the city works. Indeed, years of manual labor have toughened you up and made you strong. You may be a stevedore, hired to unload container ships, or a factory worker on an assembly line. Or perhaps, rather than working the line at the factory, you work in an auto body shop, or as a mechanic in a garage. There's no job too dirty; if it needs doing, you can do it.

One advantage of this line of work is that it brings you in contact with other laborers who have similar experiences. These like-minded groups of laborers are often in unions or, at least, share a sense of mutual aid to support one another. Work with your GM to determine whether you belong to a union or one of these informal communities. Where is it? Is it politically active?

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter medium armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill intimidation}, {@skill perception}, {@skill surival}, {@skill technology|Superheroic5E}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item vehicles (land)|phb}

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item laborer’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $300.

entries.name: Feature: Solidarity
entries: You have fellow travelers who will help you however they can. Though they can offer little by way of financial support, you can always find someone to hide you out, to offer a hand if you need some muscle to help with some labor, or to provide you a hot meal. This is especially the case if your cause is one of equality and anti-corporate justice. Of course, these laborer friends of yours might not take as kindly to your allies if they are corporate shills.

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: You work in the medical field, as a nurse, doctor, or assistant. Perhaps you went to nursing school and received your LPN or RN. There you learned how to bandage wounds, set bones, and administer medication, among other things. You also know your way around a pharmacy or hospital. Though you lack the scientific expertise and advanced training of the medical doctor, your skills can be very useful in the field. Work with your GM to determine the details of your training and former employment.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill insight}, {@skill medicine}, {@skill persuasion}, {@skill science|Superheroic5E}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item first aid kit|Superheroic5E}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item medic’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $500.

entries.name: Feature: Triage
entries: Through your training, you have learned how to treat serious injuries quickly in the field, preventing them from worsening and sometimes saving lives in the process. When you and an injured person take a short rest together, you can expend one use of a First Aid Kit to allow them to spend Hit Dice. When they do, they get the maximum amount of HP that they could, as if they had rolled the highest number on each Hit Die. This still expends the Hit Dice, though you can use this ability on yourself as well.

_.item: {@filter a simple ranged weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=ranged weapon;simple weapon|category=}

entries: You served in the army, or perhaps on a police force, and have likely seen combat as well. Your experience has marked you and those you served alongside will forever be family.

Work with your GM to determine where you served and in what capacity. Where you in the American armed forces? Local police force? Foreign military? CIA strike team? Next, determine what relationship, if any, you still have to your old organization and your former soldiersin-arms. Perhaps you still maintain relations with a few of them.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter  Simple and martial weapons|items|source=|type=martial weapon;simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=heavy armor;light armor;medium armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill perception}, {@skill intimidation}, {@skill investigation}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item vehicles (land)|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item police officer’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple ranged weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=ranged weapon;simple weapon|category=}, and $500.

entries.name: Feature: Venterans Honor
entries: Should you choose to let others know about it, your service garners you respect. Current and former members of the military, as well as the civilian police forces, will show you the respect you are due. This can assist in getting you and your allies out of trouble, to be sure. Also, you may be able to gain access to military areas and resources, or perhaps hitch a ride with a police or military group. Beware, though—word of your service might not impress those who served on the other side from you in battle, not to mention the criminal underworld!

_.item: {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}

entries: You were raised or have spent a considerable amount of time in a monastery, enclave, commune, or other isolated and insular community. Perhaps the people there were united by a common ideology; regardless, you grew to know their ways very well.

Work with your GM to determine the nature of your former community. Was it a religious community, like a monastery? Or a political one instead? Was it intentionally low tech? Or was it a scholarly enclave? Next, determine what relationship, if any, you still have to your old community and its members. Perhaps you still maintain relations with a few of them.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter light armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill history}, {@skill insight}, {@skill mysticism|Superheroic5E}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item survivalist’s pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $500.

entries.name: Feature: Practiced Arts
entries: You had to learn a broad range of skills to contribute to the proper functioning of your small enclave, given that there were so few of you compared to the wider world outside. On the other hand, there are likely some technological or cultural phenomena that passed you by when you were isolated. When you spend ten minutes with a set of artisans' tools, you can roll as though you have proficiency with it for the next hour, though you may do this with only one set of tools at a time. On the other hand, you are almost certain not to understand references to pop culture or current events.

You spent several years as a pilot, of a commercial airline or, perhaps, a cruise ship. Your years in the sky or at sea have given you ample experience with the travel industry, as well as skill piloting a variety of commercial vessels and vehicles. You may even have served in the Air Force or Navy in the past, but you've been working in the commercial industry for a while now. Indeed, unlikely as it might be, you may even have hoped to train as an astronaut.
Choose what vehicles you pilot and how you gained this experience.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor;medium armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill perception}, {@skill science|Superheroic5E}, {@skill sleight of hand}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item cartographer's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item police officer's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $500.

entries.name: Feature: Travel Industry Insider
entries: Your years spent as a pilot have made you a lot of contacts. When you need to travel, you can usually call in a favor and get on standby or at least cut a deal.

If you spend 8 hours of downtime reaching out to your contacts, you can arrange for cheap passage for you and your friends. You may have to wait on standby for hours upon end to get on a flight or ship, however.

entry: The most common form of employment, by far, is in the service industry, and you are among them. Whether you work in food service—front or back of the house—or in retail or similar, your work ultimately brings you into contact with customers, for better or worse. The good news is you have skills that make it easy for you to find work. The bad news is most of the jobs you can find don't pay very well.

Choose what area of service you worked in. Some examples are kitchen staff, wait staff, housekeeping, lawn care, IT, tourism, entertainment, sales, consulting, etc. Then work with your GM to determine where you worked. Did you leave under good circumstances or bad? The relationship with your former employer(s) may end up being important as the story unfolds!

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill athletics}, {@skill deception}, {@skill insight}, {@skill persuasion}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item Cook's Utensils|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item student's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $200.

entries.name: Feature: Pick up a Few Hours
entries: When necessary, you can find work on short notice and cover a few shifts for an employee in your former line of work. If you spend 8 hours, you can make enough money to cover cheap lodging and expenses for one person for a few days. The drawback, of course, is that you might end up sore, tired, and cranky.

_.special: simple melee weapon of your choice

entry: Isaac Newton. Marie Curie. Neil deGrasse Tyson. These figures inspire you in your relentless search for the truth about the natural world. You employ experimental methods, collecting observations, and sharing your findings with your scientific community, be it at a local university, online group, or publishing in scientific journals.

Choose your preferred area of scientific pursuit.Perhaps you study genetics, trying to discover the source of the superpowers a lucky few heroes develop. Or you study materials science, producing substances that can serve as lightweight, impenetrable armor for tomorrow's Technological heroes. Whatever your area, you conduct your experiments in a lab. Work with your GM to determine where it is and what it might contain. Is it functional? Exploded? Dangerous? Your GM may give you opportunities to visit it and conduct an experiment.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill investigation}, {@skill perception}, {@skill science|Superheroic5e}, {@skill technology|Superheroic5e}, {@skill slieght of hand}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item chemistry supplies|superheroic5e}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item student's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $500.

entries.name: Feature: The Experimental Method
entries: The answers to certain questions can be obtained through careful observation and experiment. Fueled with the current theories, you can plumb the depths of nature's secrets in your lab. If you spend 8 hours of downtime in a lab, you may roll any one nature or investigation check in the lab with advantage, if you can bring some evidence or sample of the object, phenomenon, or material you are studying to the lab with you. You can also contact your scientific colleagues to discuss questions of science. These contacts may prove to be valuable sources of information, but beware—some may view you as a rival and try to steal your secrets!

_.special: simple melee weapon of your choice

entry: You live the life of the mind. Probably, you have an advanced degree, but you might be an autodidact, however, in which case your erudition is especially impressive.Whatever its source, your knowledge is expansive and impressive, though, you focus on a particular area of study. Work with your GM to determine what your focus is and where you conduct your studies. Perhaps you delve into dusty tomes and archives to uncover the truth about history, in which case you might spend time in government buildings examining old documents. Or maybe you study ancient languages and translate Homer or Horace, while holing up at your old university. Or maybe you study the works of the great philosophers, in which case you might frequent symposiums and discuss your ideas with other scholars. You might even engage in your scholarly exchanges entirely in writing, submitting essays to prestigious journals. Wherever you work, you have built special relationships with other like-minded folks with which you share your passions. Normal folks might call you an egghead, however.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill history}, {@skill investigation}, {@skill arcana}, {@skill science|Superheroic5e}, {@skill technology|Superheroic5e}.

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Three of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item student's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a simple melee weapon of your choice|items|source=|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=|category=|miscellaneous=mundane}, and $200.

entries.name: Feature: Encyclopedist
entries: You have access to a transnational community of scholars studying a particular subject. Whenever you would like to know some fact that some expert has recorded somewhere on Earth, there's a good chance you know someone who can tell you about it. If you contact your correspondents, it may take a week or more to get a reply, but you absolutely will get the answer you seek. If you contact your local network, you will surely get some information, but it is up to the GM to determine how complete that information is.

You grew up well outside of the city. Your people work the land and have for generations. Indeed, the way the elders in your community tell it, you are the land. You likely worked a particular crop or bred a domesticated animal or two and know them best, but your agrarian life taught you how to grow a variety of crops, as well as raise other forms of livestock.

Something led you to leave your quiet rural life behind, however, and come to the city. Was it when you got your powers? What happened? Work with your GM to imagine a story that brings you from there to where you are now. Be sure to include conflict in the tale, so that the GM might invoke it at a later moment in the story!

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor;medium armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill animal handling}, {@skill athletics}, {@skill medicine}, {@skill science|Superheroic5E}, {@skill survival}.

items.name: Tool Proficiencies
items.entry: {@item vehicles (land)|phb}, {@item artisan's tools|phb}

items.name: Languages
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: a {@item survivalist's pack|Superheroic5E}, {@filter a bolt-action rifle|items|type=!treasure|search=rif}, and $100.

entries.name: Feature: Live Off the Land
entries: Unlike your urban brothers and sisters, you have learned how to live off the land beyond the city walls. Your experience growing up has taught you how to identify edible plants, to catch predators who might stalk your livestock, and to find clean drinking water. You can provide food and water for one person for every two hours you spend dedicated to the task of hunting, foraging, fishing, or trapping. Some urbanites may allow their origin prejudices to affect how they view you, however, so expect the occasional haughty reaction from certain members of high society.

_.special: A line of credit with the local rideshare company.

entry: Some say you had an easy upbringing. In one sense, of course you did—the most privileged imaginable, really. Even so, satisfying your distant and perfectionist parents wasn't easy, to say the least. You learned, though, how to maneuver among the rich and powerful elite, which turns out to be a useful life skill after all. Work with your GM to determine if your parents are still around, whether you are the young new CEO of a major corporation, or just a celebrity socialite.

items.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies
items.entry: {@filter Simple weapons|items|source=|type=simple weapon|category=}, {@filter all armor|items|source=|type=light armor|category=}

items.name: Skill Proficiencies
items.entry: Choose three: {@skill history}, {@skill intimidation}, {@skill arcana}, {@skill performance}, {@skill persuasion}.

items.name: Languages
items.entry: Two of your choice

items.name: Musical Instrument
items.entry: One of your choice

items.name: Equipment
items.entry: A line of credit with the local rideshare company, a cutting edge cell phone, and an artisan wallet.

entries.name: Feature: The Privilege of Wealth
entries: Because of your wealth and family name, you can go places and do things others cannot. By dropping your name (or your parents' names), you can bypass security, get into clubs, and get short notice meetings with virtually anyone in power. Of course, there are some folks who might not react so deferentially!

entry: Maybe the list of provided backgrounds doesn't quite capture what your character's been up to, you can create one tailor-made instead. What might your hero have been doing before becoming a superhero? Where were they living? What was their job, if any? If you choose this background, describe your life before superheroics. Work with your GM to make it interesting and fun.

entries.name: Feature: Special
entries: You can choose a feature from one of the other backgrounds or you can make your own. If you wish to make a custom background feature, then identify an important institution, organization, or community from your custom background. When you interact with them, you receive special treatment that either saves you time and money or can provide you something mildly valuable, such as food and lodging or some useful information.

entries.name: Armor and Weapons Proficiencies:
entries: Select two types of each as appropriate.

entries.name: Skill Proficiencies:
entries: Pick three of your choice.

entries.name: Languages or Tools:
entries: One tool proficiency and two languages of your choice. If proficient in martial weapons, only choose two total languages or tools.

entries.name: Equipment:
entries: One pack and $300 to purchase equipment, weapons, or tools.
